            	def get_exchange_rate	
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                    # Getting exchange currency (curl)
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                    
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                    if session[:exchange_rate].nil? || session[:exchange_rate] == "null"
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

            			currency_rates = URI.parse('https://www.nbkr.kg/XML/daily.xml').read
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

            			currency_json = Hash.from_xml(currency_rates).to_json
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

            			currency_hash = JSON.parse(currency_json)
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

            	        currency_usd = currency_hash["CurrencyRates"]["Currency"][0]["Value"]
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

            			exchange_rate_usd = currency_usd.gsub(/[.,]/, '.' => '', ',' => '.').to_f	
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

            			session[:exchange_rate] = exchange_rate_usd.to_json
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

            			render json: {session_ex_rate: session[:exchange_rate] }
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

            		else
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

            			render json: {session_ex_rate: session[:exchange_rate] }
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38.

      39.

                def user_params

    app/helpers/application_helper.rb

            module ApplicationHelper
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            1
            

            

                def link_to_add_fields(name, form, association)
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            
            

            

                  new_object = form.object.send(association).klass.new
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            
            

            

                  id = new_object.object_id
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
            

            

                  fields = form.fields_for(association, new_object, child_index: id) do |builder|
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            
            

            

                    render(association.to_s.singularize + "_fields", form: builder)
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

                  link_to(name, '#', class: "add_fields", data: {id: id, fields: fields.gsub("\n", "")})
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

            
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            1
            

            

                def sortable(column, title = nil)
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

                  title ||= column.titleize      
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                  direction = column == sort_column && sort_direction == "asc" ? "desc" : "asc"
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

                  link_to title, :sort => column, :direction => direction
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

            end

              def self.search(search, product_select, start_date, end_date)

              def self.current_inventory_for(product_id)

              def self.remove_inventory(product_id, amount)
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            3
            

            

                amount_left_to_remove = amount
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            3
            

            

                Inventory.where("product_id = ? and current_amount_left > 0", product_id).order(:created_at, :id).each do |inv|  
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            3
            

            

                  break if amount_left_to_remove == 0
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            3
            

            

                  amount_to_remove = [inv.current_amount_left, amount_left_to_remove].min
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            3
            

            

                  inv.current_amount_left = inv.current_amount_left - amount_to_remove
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                      
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            3
            

            

                  amount_left_to_remove = amount_left_to_remove - amount_to_remove
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            3
            

            

                  res = inv.save  
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                end 
          
      63.

              def self.add_inventory(product_id, amount, recipe_price)

              def set_costs  	
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            5
            

            

              	if self.id == nil
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            2
            

            

              		self.current_amount_left = 0
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

              	end
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

            
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            5
            

            

                if self.amount == nil
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                  self.amount = 0
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

            
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            5
            

            

                self.costs = self.amount * self.price_per_unit
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

                # Delta of purchased shows the change and what was saved. If it were 100 saved and then they decided to change it to 120, then the delta is 20.
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            5
            

            

                delta_of_purchased = self.amount - (self.amount_was || 0)
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            5
            

            

                self.current_amount_left = self.current_amount_left + delta_of_purchased   
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      84.

    app/models/my_sorter.rb

    12.38% lines covered

    105 relevant lines. 13 lines covered and 92 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1. 
            1
            

            

            class MySorter
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            1
            

            

              def self.selection_sort(array) 
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            
            

            

                # Step 1: Go through the array
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            
            

            

                # Step 2: Find the smallest element of array using get_min method
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
            

            

                # Step 3: Delete that smallest element from the array 
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            
            

            

                # Step 4: Assign deleted element of array to arr.
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

                # Step 5: Keep doing step 1 through 4 until there is nothing left in the array.
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

                # Step 6: The loop should break when array is empty.
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

                arr = []
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

                while !array.empty?
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

                  arr.push(array.delete(get_min(array)))
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                arr # You can write return before arr just to that it's returning arr. 
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

            # Making bubble_sort 
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

            # Step 1: Go through the array. 
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

            # Step 2: Compare next 2 elements of the array.
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

            # Step 3: Find the smallest among those two.
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

            # Step 4: If second element is lesser than first, swap the places.
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

            # Step 5: If it is not, leave them as they are. 
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

            # Step 6: Go to the next two elements.
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

            # Step 7: Do the same with them.
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

            # Step 8: Stop when you iterated through the whole array and it didn't swap.
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            1
            

            

              def self.bubble_sort(array)
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                array_length = array.size 
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                loop do 
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                  swapped = false
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                  (array_length-1).times do |i|
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                    if array[i] > array[i+1]
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                      array[i], array[i+1] = array[i+1], array[i]
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                      swapped = true
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                  break if not swapped 
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                array
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

             
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            1
            

            

              def self.hash_sort_by_value(sample_hash)
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                # h = {c: 1, d: 5, e: 4, a: 2, b: 3}
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                # should return [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                self.selection_sort(sample_hash.values)
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

            
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            1
            

            

              def self.hash_sort_by_key(hash_to_sort)
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                # h = {c: 1, d: 5, e: 4, a: 2, b: 3}
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                # should return [2, 3, 1, 5, 4]
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                sorted_keys = self.selection_sort(hash_to_sort.keys)
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

                sorted_values = []
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

                sorted_keys.each do |sk|
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                  sorted_values.push(hash_to_sort[sk])
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                sorted_values
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

            
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            1
            

            

              def self.get_min(array)
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                min = nil
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                array.each do |a|
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                  if min.nil?
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                    min = a
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                  elsif min > a
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                    min = a 
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                min
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

            
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

              # Reverse a string using a while loop
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            1
            

            

              def self.reverse_string(word)
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                word = word.chars
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                # word = ['s', 'e', 'n', 't', 'e', 'n', 'c', 'e']
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                reversed_word = ''
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                # start at the last letter of the word
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                # write down the letter
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                # go to the previous letter
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                # write it down
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

                # stop when there are no letters left
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

                position = word.length - 1
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

                # while word.length > 0
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

                # while !word.blank?
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

                # while !word.empty?
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

                while position >= 0
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

                  reversed_word += word[position]
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

                  position -= 1
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                reversed_word 
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

            
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            1
            

            

              def self.merge_sort(array)
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

              # Break up the problem.
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

              # How to divide the array of integers into two equal arrays of integers? 
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

              # I have to create a loop. In that loop I have to take the array and get it's length. 
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

              # Divide the length in two. First half of the array divide by length assign to variable left_side, the rest should be assigned to the variable 
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

              # right_side. 
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

            
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                sorted_arr = []
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                if array.length > 1
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                  splitted_array = array.in_groups(2, false)
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                  left_array = merge_sort(splitted_array[0])
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

                  right_array = merge_sort(splitted_array[1])
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

            
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                  li = 0
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

                  ri = 0
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

                  while li < left_array.length && ri < right_array.length
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

                    if left_array[li] <= right_array[ri]
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                      sorted_arr.push(left_array[li]) 
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

                      li += 1      
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                    elsif left_array[li] >= right_array[ri]
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

                      sorted_arr.push(right_array[ri]) 
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

                      ri += 1     
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

                  while li < left_array.length
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                    sorted_arr.push(left_array[li])
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

                    li += 1
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

                  
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

                  while ri < right_array.length 
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

                    sorted_arr.push(right_array[ri])
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

                    ri += 1
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

                else
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

                  sorted_arr = array
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

                end 
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

                return sorted_arr
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

              
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

              # Break up the problem.
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

              # How to divide the array of integers into two equal arrays of integers? 
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

              # I have to create a loop. In that loop I have to take the array and get it's length. 
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

              # Divide the length in two. First half of the array divide by length assign to variable left_side, the rest should be assigned to the variable 
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

              # right_side. 
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

              # Breaking up the problem is the complexity in quick sort. How do you break up the problem. 
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

              # Understand the algorithm. Understand the condition upon which you know its done. 
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

              # How do you break up the indencies an what is the base case? 
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

              # When you think of a quick sort think about the word pivot. 
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

              # Pivot is one of the items in the array that meets the following three conditions after we sorted it.
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

              # 1. Correct position in final, sorted array. 
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

              # 2. Items to the left are smaller. 
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

              # 3. Items to the right are larger. 
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

            
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

              # Step 1: Choose a pivot. 
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

              # Step 2: Move the pivot to the end of the array to get it out of the way. 
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

              # Step 3: We are gonna look for two items. 
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

              # 1. itemFromLeft that is larger than pivot. 
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

              # 2. itemFromRight that is smaller than pivot. 
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

              # If the item from left is larger than the pivot and the item from right, swap item from left with right. 
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

              # Keep swapping items in that way. 
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

              # Stop when index of itemFromLeft > index of itemFromRight. 
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

              # Step 4: Swap the last item from left with the pivot. 
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

              # Our pivot is now in the correct spot. 
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

              # It's in the correct spot when all the items from the left are smaller and all items from the right are larger. 
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

              # Quick sort is recursive, method calls itself. 
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

              # Step 5: We take all the itemsFromRight. Implement the same method to the itemsFromRight. 
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

              # How do we choose the pivot? Median-of-three. 
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

              # In this method we look at the first, middle and last elements of the array.
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

              # We sort them properly and choose the middle item as our pivot.
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

            
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

              # Does:
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

               # Groups everything according to the pivot.
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

               # Gets the index of the pivot. 
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

              # Takes: 
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

               # Takes the array you want to partition. The starting point of that array and the ending point. 
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

              # Returns: the position of the pivot. 
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            1
            

            

              def self.partition(array, low, high)
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                pivot_value = array[high]
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                right = high - 1
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                left = low    
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

            
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

                while left < right  
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

                  if array[left] <= pivot_value
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                    left += 1
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

                  elsif array[right] > pivot_value 
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

                    right -= 1
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

                  elsif array[left] >= pivot_value && array[right] <= pivot_value
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

                    swap(array, left, right)  
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

                # position of pivot is what?
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

                position_of_pivot = high
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

                if pivot_value < array[left]
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

                  swap(array, left, position_of_pivot)
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

                  position_of_pivot = left 
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                return position_of_pivot
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

            
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

              # Does:
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

                # It sorts an array between the left and right indexes.
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            
            

            

              # Takes: 
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            
            

            

                # It takes three arguments.
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

                # Array is the array to be sorted. 
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

                # It will start sorting from the left_index.
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

                # It will sort up to the right_index. 
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            
            

            

              # Returns: 
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            
            

            

                # Returns the sorted array. 
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            1
            

            

              def self.quick_sort(array, left_index, right_index)
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            
            

            

                if left_index < right_index 
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            
            

            

                  j = partition(array, left_index, right_index)
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

                  quick_sort(array, left_index, j-1)
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            
            

            

                  quick_sort(array, j+1, right_index)
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            
            

            

                return array
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            
            

            

            
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            1
            

            

              def self.swap(arr, p1, p2)
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            
            

            

                arr[p1], arr[p2] = arr[p2], arr[p1]
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            
            

            

              # Does: changes the last element of the arrays with the second element.
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            
            

            

              # Takes: an array of arrays. 
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            
            

            

              # Returns: the second and the last elements of the array in each array_of_arrays switched places. 
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            
            

            

            
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            1
            

            

              def self.swap_two(array_of_arrays)
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            
            

            

                # [[a, x, b, y], [c, x, d, y], [e, x, f, y]]
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            
            

            

                # Here we have an array of arrays. Every inside array has 4 elements.
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            
            

            

                # The result should be: [[a, y, b, x], [c, y, d, x], [e, y, f, x]]
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            
            

            

                # Go through each inner array and swap the second item with the last item.
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            
            

            

                switched_elements = []
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            
            

            

                array_of_arrays.each do |arar|
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            
            

            

                  if arar[1] == 'x' && arar[3] == 'y'
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            
            

            

                    arar[1], arar[3] = arar[3], arar[1]
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            
            

            

                    switched_elements.push(arar)
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            
            

            

                return switched_elements 
          
      228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    228. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            
            

            

            
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            1
            

            

              def self.find_deepest(arr, depth=0)
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            
            

            

              # 3 Laws of Recursion
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            
            

            

              # A recursive algorithm must call itself, recursively.
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            
            

            

              # A recursive algorithm must have a base case.
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234. 
            
            

            

              # A recursive algorithm must change its state and move toward the base case.
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            
            

            

              # tmp = [['1a'], ['1b', ['2a']], ['1c', '1d', ['2b'], ['2c', '2d', ['3a']]], [[['3b']]]]
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            
            

            

            
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            
            

            

              # Step 1: How to reduce the problem. 
          
      238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    238. 
            
            

            

              # Step 2: How do I recognize that the problem can't be broken down anymore. That's gonna be the base case. 
          
      239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    239. 
            
            

            

              # Step 3: Once it's down on the simplest version it's gonna go back, how to merge the result. 
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            
            

            

              # Step 4: A clear example of what the method should return. Write out a sample problem and a sample of what it should return. 
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            
            

            

            
          
      242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    242. 
            
            

            

              # Example of the method
          
      243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    243. 
            
            

            

              # Takes the array of arrays tmp = [['1a'], ['1b', ['2a']], ['1c', '1d', ['2b'], ['2c', '2d', ['3a']]], [[['3b']]]]
          
      244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    244. 
            
            

            

              # Goes through the array of arrays and looks for the depth=1 first time, then depth=2 second time and keeps doing it until reaches the deepest (['3a']) and ['3b']. 
          
      245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    245. 
            
            

            

              # Returns the deepest. If there are several elements on the same depth, returns all of them (['3a'], ['3b']).
          
      246. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    246. 
            
            

            

            
          
      247. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    247. 
            
            

            

                deepest_val = {depth: depth, values: []}
          
      248. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    248. 
            
            

            

                arr.each do |a|
          
      249. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    249. 
            
            

            

                  if a.kind_of?(Array)
          
      250. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    250. 
            
            

            

                     dep = find_deepest(a, depth + 1)
          
      251. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    251. 
            
            

            

                       if dep[:depth] > deepest_val[:depth]
          
      252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    252. 
            
            

            

                         deepest_val = dep
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            
            

            

                       else dep[:depth] == deepest_val[:depth]
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            
            

            

                          deepest_val[:values] += dep[:values]
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            
            

            

                       end
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            
            

            

                  else
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            
            

            

                    deepest_val[:values].push a
          
      258. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    258. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    259. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      260. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    260. 
            
            

            

                return deepest_val
          
      261. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    261. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      262. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    262. 
            
            

            

            end
          
      263.

    103 relevant lines. 44 lines covered and 59 lines missed.

                self.grand_total = 0

      31.

            4
            

            

                      byebug

            4

                      byebug

                      break
          
      38.

      39.

            2

      40.

      46.

      47.

              def self.search(search, client_select, start_date, end_date)
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

                where_statements = []

    90. 
            
            

            

                if !search.blank?

    91. 
            
            

            

                  tmp = "(clients.name ILIKE '%#{search}%'

              def self.client_report(search_text, client_ids, sortable, sort_direction)

                if client_ids.blank? || client_ids == [""]
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

                  client_id_where = ""

    134. 
            
            

            

                else

                  client_id_where = "client_id IN (#{client_ids.join(", ")})"
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

            
          
      138.

                where_clause = WhereBuilder.build([client_id_where, search_text_where])

                sql = """
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

                    SELECT *
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

                    FROM (
          
      143.

      145.

      149.

      152.

              def self.product_report(search_text, product_ids, start_date, end_date, sortable, sort_direction)
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                if !["product_id", "product_name", "price", "amount_sold", "amount_made", "average_unit_price", "weighted_average_sale_price"].include?(sortable)
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                  sortable = "product_name"  
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                end      
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

            
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

                if sort_direction  == "desc"
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

                  "desc"      
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

                else
          
      165.

      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

                search_text_where = " (product_name ILIKE '%#{search_text}%' 
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                                       OR price = #{search_text.to_d} 
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                                       OR amount_sold = #{search_text.to_d} 
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                                       OR amount_made = #{search_text.to_d} 
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                                       OR average_unit_price = #{search_text.to_d} 
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

                                       OR product_id = #{search_text.to_i} )"     
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

                
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                if search_text.blank?
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

                  search_text_where = ""
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

            
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

                if product_ids.blank? || product_ids == [""]
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

                  product_id_where = ""
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

                else
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

                  product_id_where = "(product_id IN (#{product_ids.join(", ")}) )"
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

                
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

                date_filter_where = "WHERE created_at >= cast(now() as date) - interval '30' day"
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

                if start_date.blank? || end_date.blank?
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

                  date_filter_where = "WHERE created_at >= cast(now() as date) - interval '30' day" 
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                else
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

                  date_filter_where = "WHERE CAST(created_at AS DATE) >= #{SqlHelper.escape_sql_param(start_date.to_date)} 
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                                       AND CAST(created_at AS DATE) <= #{SqlHelper.escape_sql_param(end_date.to_date)}"
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

                end  
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

            
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            
            

            

                where_clause = WhereBuilder.build([product_id_where, search_text_where])
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            
            

            

                
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

            
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

                sql = """
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

                      SELECT *
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            
            

            

                      FROM (
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            
            

            

                            SELECT 
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            
            

            

                                 sale_prices.product_id,
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            
            

            

                                 products.product_name,
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            
            

            

                                 products.price,
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

                                 sale_prices.amount_sold,
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            
            

            

                                 sale_prices.amount_made,
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            
            

            

                                 sale_prices.average_unit_price,
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            
            

            

                                 sale_prices.weighted_average_sale_price,
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            
            

            

                                 weighted_average_sale.weighted_average
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            
            

            

                            FROM products
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            
            

            

                            INNER JOIN 
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            
            

            

                                      (
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            
            

            

                                       SELECT  
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            
            

            

                                          SUM(quantity) AS amount_sold, 
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            
            

            

                                          SUM(subtotal) AS amount_made,
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            
            

            

                                          round(AVG(sale_price)::numeric, 2) AS average_unit_price,
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            
            

            

                                          product_id,
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            
            

            

                                          SUM(sale_price * quantity) / SUM(NULLIF(quantity,0)) AS weighted_average_sale_price
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            
            

            

                                       FROM order_products
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            
            

            

                                       #{date_filter_where}
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            
            

            

                                       GROUP BY product_id
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            
            

            

                                      ) sale_prices ON products.id = sale_prices.product_id
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            
            

            

                            INNER JOIN 
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            
            

            

                                      (
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            
            

            

                                       SELECT 
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            
            

            

                                         product_id, 
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            
            

            

                                         ROUND(SUM(price_per_unit * current_amount_left) / SUM(NULLIF(current_amount_left,0)), 2) AS weighted_average
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            
            

            

                                       FROM inventories
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226. 
            
            

            

                                       GROUP BY product_id
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            
            

            

                                      ) weighted_average_sale on products.id = weighted_average_sale.product_id
          
      228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    228. 
            
            

            

                              
          
      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            
            

            

                            ) report
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            
            

            

                            #{where_clause}
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            
            

            

                      ORDER BY #{sortable} #{sort_direction}                      
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            
            

            

                  """
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            
            

            

                result = ActiveRecord::Base.connection.execute(sql)
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234. 
            
            

            

              end

              def set_current_amount_left

              def self.search(search, recipe_select, start_date, end_date)

                where_statements = []

                if !search.blank?

      13.

    20. 
            
            

            

                if !recipe_select.blank?
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                  ids = []
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

                  recipe_select.each do |ps|
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                    ids.push(ps.to_i)
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                  tmp = "recipe_id in (#{SqlHelper.escape_sql_param(ids)})"
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                  where_statements.push(tmp)
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

            
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                if !start_date.blank? && !end_date.blank?
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                  where_statements.push("(CAST(productions.created_at AS DATE) >= #{SqlHelper.escape_sql_param(start_date.to_date)} AND CAST(productions.created_at AS DATE) <= #{SqlHelper.escape_sql_param(end_date.to_date)})")

      32.

    33. 
            
            

            

                return Production.joins(:recipe).where(where_clause)
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

            
          
      36.

            1
            

            

              def set_total
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                self.grand_total = 0
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                self.grand_total = product_amount.to_d * recipe_price.to_d
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                # production has_many recipes, recipe has_many recipe_products.
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

            
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                finale = 0
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                recipe.recipe_products.each do |rp|
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                  # cal weighted average for each recipe product
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                  value_of_item = 0 
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                  sum_of_amount = 0 
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                  
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                  Inventory.where("product_id = ? and amount > 0", rp.product_id).each do |inv|
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                    value_of_item += inv.amount * inv.price_per_unit
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                    sum_of_amount += inv.amount
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

                  weighted_average = value_of_item / sum_of_amount     
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                  # cal weighted_average for amount of the ingredient for the product
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                  ingredient_weighted_average = weighted_average * rp.product_amount
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                  finale += ingredient_weighted_average * self.product_amount
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                  
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                self.cost_to_make = finale
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

            
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            1
            

            

              def set_current_amount_left   
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                change_in_quantity = product_amount - (product_amount_was || 0)
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

            
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                recipe.recipe_products.each do |rp|         
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                  Inventory.remove_inventory(rp.product_id, (rp.product_amount || 0) * change_in_quantity)
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                Inventory.add_inventory(recipe.product_id, product_amount, recipe_price) 
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

            end
          
      69.

                def self.get_permissions
